intro: Vernonia fandrarazanensis, commonly known as the Madagascar ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native region. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
